channel.title: Washington D.C. Landmarks
channel.description: Interesting Landmarks around the Nation's Capital

item.title: Union Station
item.description: Union Station is a major train station, transportation hub, and leisure destination
item.author: mat.timmins@gmail.com

item.title: Lincoln Memorial
item.description: The Lincoln Memorial is an American national monument built to honor the 16th President of the United States, Abraham Lincoln
item.author: mat.timmins@gmail.com

item.title: United States Naval Observatory
item.description: The United States Naval Observatory is one of the oldest scientific agencies in the United States, with a primary mission to produce Positioning, Navigation and Timing for the U.S. Navy and the U.S. Department of Defense
item.author: mat.timmins@gmail.com

item.title: Pentagon
item.description: The Pentagon is the headquarters of the United States Department of Defense, located in Arlington County, Virginia
item.author: mat.timmins@gmail.com

item.title: Kennedy Center
item.description: The John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts is a performing arts center located on the Potomac River, adjacent to the Watergate complex
item.author: mat.timmins@gmail.com
